contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Azuma'''|東村|Azuma-mura}}, located in [[Seta District, Gunma|Seta District]], [[Gunma Prefecture|Gunma]], [[Japan]], was one of three separate [[villages of Japan|village]]s named ''Azuma'' ("East Village") in Gunma Prefecture. On March 27, 2006 Azuma was merged with the town of [[Omama, Gunma|Ōmama]], from [[Yamada District, Gunma|Yamada District]], and the town of [[Kasakake, Gunma|Kasakake]], from [[Nitta District, Gunma|Nitta District]], to form the new city of [[Midori, Gunma|Midori]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 3,036 and a [[population density|density]] of 21.45 persons per km². The total area was 141.57 km². The village was established in 1889. ==External links== * [http://www.city.midori.gunma.jp/ Midori official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Gunma Prefecture]] {{Gunma-geo-stub}}
